title: MVP #2: FitPics.co
text: A conversation with personal fitness trainer Mohammed “Mo” Ahmed (@mobamba_fitness on Instagram) inspired our latest product, Fitpics.co. Mo has spent years transforming his physique and health and has begun sharing his knowledge through personal training. With his first clients, he shared with us the value of keeping them accountable by having them send progress pictures after each workout. This led our team to the concept of a text based accountability partner and progress tracker.

title: MVP #2: FitPics.co
text:
Final Product and Features



Enter your phone number to opt-in to curated daily motivational videos and texts.





Upload past photos from your camera role or text in a progress photo anytime.





Track your progress over time and greate a progress video in just one click.

title: MVP #2: FitPics.co
text:
How We Built It

Supabase for our database and user authentication
Next.js for our frontend
Twilio for our SMS messaging
Vercel for our hosting
shadcn for styling

This project was built by two engineers over two weekends.
It’s publicly available and free at FitPics.co.
Check out out on Twitter @weekend_mvp.

title: MVP #1: ConectRe.com
text:
After connecting with many students at the Rutgers Real Estate Club, I realized that many of them were looking for a way to stay in touch with their contacts. I decided to build a web app to help them do just that.
It’s publicly available at ConectRE.com.

title: MVP #1: ConectRe.com
text:
Key Features



View of contacts to track information, past conversations, and set reminders.





Homepage to easily track all contacts and reminders.





Auth powered by Supabase AuthUI with sign in with Google enabled.

title: MVP #1: ConectRe.com
text:
Tech and Stack
This project was built over two weekends. It uses a NextJS frontend with Supabase as the backend. The frontend is deployed on Vercel. Styling is done with TailwindCSS.

title: Weekend MVP
text:
Weekend MVP was started to challenge the idea that bringing an idea to reality should be a long and expensive process.
In fact, we’ve set out to prove that a few engineers can launch products in as short as a single weekend!

title: Weekend MVP
text:
Have an idea?
We’re looking for entrepreneurs, influencers, and creative thinkers to share their ideas and stories.
If you’d like to be eligible for a free MVP, dm us on twitter or submit your idea below.
Submit your idea here (to do: add a form)
